body_html: While trying out Polly on the generated LLVM IR is useful to explore, the application of Polly there may be at too low a level to realize the full potential of polyhedral analyses/transformations. It will instead be more powerful to explore them on HLO IR itself, as part of its target dependent analyses and optimizations (SCoPs can perhaps be extracted from HLO IR there, transformed, and HLO IR written back). This in particular will provide the freedom to perform data layout/memory optimizations in conjunction with execution reordering -- information necessary to enable the former will be hard / nearly infeasible once LLVM IR has been generated (array liveness information in particular). This in turn will limit the effectiveness of the latter (exec reordering).
